contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=October 2008}} {{infobox shopping mall | | shopping_mall_name = Victoria Gardens | image =Victoria gardens shopping centre abbotsford.jpg|150px | image_width = 180 | caption = | location = [[Richmond, Victoria]], [[Australia]] | coordinates = | opening_date = 3 April 2003 | owner = Centro Wholesale (50%), Salta (50%) <ref>http://www.centro.com.au/Shopping+Centres/Shopping+Centre+Directory/Victoria+Gardens/Victoria+Gardens+Overview.htm</ref> | manager = [[Centro Properties Group]] | developer= [[Centro Properties Group]] | number_of_stores = 80 | number_of_anchors = 11 | floor_area = 45,000 mÂ² | parking = 2,173 | floors = 2 of stores and 5 of car parking | website = [http://www2.centro.com.au/VictoriaGardens/ Victoria Gardens] }} '''Victoria Gardens''' is a regional shopping centre located in [[Richmond, Victoria|Richmond]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]] approximately {{convert|4|km|mi|1}} east of [[Melbourne]]'s [[central business district]]. It is located on the corner of Victoria and Burnley Streets, Richmond at the eastern end of the Richmond commercial, retail and residential precinct. The shopping centre has a Gross Lettable Area of {{convert|45000|m2|sqft|abbr=on}}, 2,173 parking spaces and approximately 80 specialty retailers. ==History== Victoria Gardens was officially opened on 3 April 2003. It occupies the site of the former [[Vickers Ruwolt]] engineering works which manufactured large industrial components and was the location of some iconic photography by [[Wolfgang Sievers]]. The site was an undeveloped "bomb site" for nearly 20 years prior to the construction of the centre. Victoria Gardens shopping centre is part of the greater Victoria Gardens Precinct Development a joint venture by [[Salta Properties]] and [[Centro Properties Group]].<ref>http://www.centro.com.au/Shopping+Centres/Shopping+Centre+Directory/Victoria+Gardens/Victoria+Gardens+Overview.htm</ref> ==Anchors== *[[Coles Supermarkets|Coles]] supermarket. *[[Kmart Australia|Kmart]] discount department store. *[[Ikea]] furniture store. *Freedom furniture store. *[[Hoyts]] cinema. *[[Ardent Leisure|Kingpin Bowling]] lounge. ==Transport== The centre is accessible by the Route 109 Tram (Port Melbourne to Box Hill).<ref>http://www.vicgardens.com.au/centre-information/getting-here/</ref> ==External links== *[http://www2.centro.com.au/VictoriaGardens/ Victoria Gardens] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Shopping centres in Victoria}} {{coord|37|48|46|S|145|0|40|E|region:AU-VIC_type:landmark|display=title}} [[Category:Shopping centres in Melbourne]] [[Category:Shopping malls established in 2003]]
